CONJUGATES: plural: pessimists | related noun: pessimism | related adjective: pessimistic | related adverb: pessimistically
ETYMOLOGY: From French pessimiste, from Latin pessimus ('worst'), superlative of malus ('bad'). Coined in the 18th century, popularized by Voltaire in the 18th century in reference to the philosophy of Leibniz, but gained wider currency in the 19th century.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who tends to see the worst aspect of things or believe that the worst will happen.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 悲观主义者；凡事都往坏处想的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He's such a pessimist; he always expects the worst outcome, even when things look good.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他真是个悲观主义者；即使事情看起来不错，他也总是预料到最坏的结果。
